channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bins on Theydon Road NOTRESOLVED!, 10th July
item.description:
I have previously reported the overflowing bins in the pocket park next to the doctors surgery on Theydon Road. I had an update to say they have been resolved. They have not. They are worse than ever. Please actually go and look at them! Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No communal waste bin on tudor grove, 10th July
item.description:
The large communal waste bin on Tudor Grove E9 has been missing for days. Rubbish is piling up, especially dangerous in this heatwave, attracting vermin and creating a health hazard. This is unacceptable given the high council tax we pay. Replace asap!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 10th July
item.description:
The fox was reported on pavement but a passerby has put it in brown bin needs to be collected asap. I've been sent a message saying its resolved and it hasn't. It's located in the brown bin that doesn't belong to anyone it has a broken lid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Exmouth Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Fencing and grass cutting, 10th July
item.description:
Fencing repair and painting of the side of flats in Anstridge Road along the pathway to Alderwood Road The rear if the flats has not been mowed for ever Please can this be dealt with

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 148, Anstridge Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need to be maintained, 10th July
item.description:
I work and live in the local area, the faeces of bird droppings from these trees is phenomenal, the trees need to be cut back, they are too big for where they are. The people that live here, I feel for them because they must have no light and the trees are touching the roof of the houses. But I'm constantly walking into the road, because if the droppings. This is the same on the road of Delaford road, that tree is too big and un maintained. If you look down the bottom of Credon Road they are definitely too big aswell. Just feel they need to be looked at, for people's safety. I'm just a concerned resident, looking out for others. Dan
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Newly planted tree - dying off, 10th July
item.description:
Hi there. This tree just outside 2 Kellett Road seems to be dying off and it was gone literally like two weeks ago.. can you please check as what I have noticed is that the green casing around is full of water, probably drowning the tree? Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kellett Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
